headline: The First Emoji Was Created by One Person in 3 Months
body: Shigetaka Kurita designed all 176 original emojis for NTT DoCoMo in Japan in 1999. Each was a 12Ã—12 pixel grid. He was inspired by manga, Chinese characters, and weather forecasts. He made them to help people express emotion in text-limited messages.
root_connection: Those original 176 emoji are now in the permanent collection of the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) in New York City.
share_text: The first emoji was created by one person in 3 months - Shigetaka Kurita in 1999
